meanings.definition: Lacking in quantity or quality; scant or inadequate.
meanings.sent1: The meal provided was meagrest, barely filling our stomachs.
meanings.sent2: The meagrest amount of effort was put into decorating the room.
meanings.sent3: He tried to impress with his meagrest magic trick, but it fell flat.
meanings.sent4: Her meagrest attempt at painting still managed to capture the essence of the landscape.
meanings.sent5: The meagrest light from the candle barely illuminated the dark room.

meanings.definition: Of poor quality or small amount.
meanings.sent1: The meagrest excuse for being late was that he overslept.
meanings.sent2: She received the meagrest reward for her hard work.
meanings.sent3: The meagrest toy in the store caught the child's attention the most.
meanings.sent4: His meagrest performance on stage left the audience disappointed.
meanings.sent5: The meagrest fabric tore easily, showing its poor quality.

meanings.sent1: The stray cat looked meagrest, in need of food and care.
meanings.sent2: After being lost in the woods, he emerged looking meagrest.
meanings.sent3: The meagrest dog in the shelter wagged its tail happily.
meanings.sent4: His meagrest appearance surprised his friends who hadn't seen him in years.
meanings.sent5: The meagrest horse in the stable was still strong and resilient.
